verses.verse: Why do the heathen <WH1471> rage <WH7283> <WH8804>, and the people <WH3816> imagine <WH1897> <WH8799> a vain thing <WH7385> ?

The kings <WH4428> of the earth <WH776> set <WH3320> <WH8691> themselves, and the rulers <WH7336> <WH8802> take counsel <WH3245> <WH8738> together <WH3162>, against the YY <WH3068>, and against his anointed <WH4899>, saying,
Let us break <WH5423> their bands <WH4147> asunder <WH5423> <WH8762>, and cast away <WH7993> <WH8686> their cords <WH5688> from us.
He that sitteth <WH3427> <WH8802> in the heavens <WH8064> shall laugh <WH7832> <WH8799>: the YY <WH136> shall have them in derision <WH3932> <WH8799>.
Then shall he speak <WH1696> <WH8762> unto them in his wrath <WH639>, and vex <WH926> <WH8762> them in his sore displeasure <WH2740>.
Yet have I set <WH5258> <WH8804> my king <WH4428> upon my holy <WH6944> hill <WH2022> of TZiyon <WH6726>.
I will declare <WH5608> <WH8762> the decree <WH2706>: the YY <WH3068> hath said <WH559> <WH8804> unto me, Thou art my Son <WH1121>; this day <WH3117> have I begotten <WH3205> <WH8804> thee.

Ask <WH7592> <WH8798> of me, and I shall give <WH5414> <WH8799> thee the heathen <WH1471> for thine inheritance <WH5159>, and the uttermost parts <WH657> of the earth <WH776> for thy possession <WH272>.
Thou shalt break <WH7489> <WH8799> them with a rod <WH7626> of iron <WH1270>; thou shalt dash them in pieces <WH5310> <WH8762> like a potter's <WH3335> <WH8802> vessel <WH3627>.
Be wise <WH7919> <WH8685> now therefore, O ye kings <WH4428>: be instructed <WH3256> <WH8734>, ye judges <WH8199> <WH8802> of the earth <WH776>.
Serve <WH5647> <WH8798> the YY <WH3068> with fear <WH3374>, and rejoice <WH1523> <WH8798> with trembling <WH7461>.

Kiss <WH5401> <WH8761> the Son <WH1248>, lest he be angry <WH599> <WH8799>, and ye perish <WH6> <WH8799> from the way <WH1870>, when his wrath <WH639> is kindled <WH1197> <WH8799> but a little <WH4592>. Blessed <WH835> are all they that put their trust <WH2620> <WH8802> in him.
